record.author: Barlow (2024), Grace (1955), Pearson & van den Berg (2008), Ross (1977-1982), Wycliffe Bible Translators (2009)
record.notes:
Barlow, Russell. 2024. Lote wordlist: Based on elicitation sessions with Leo Lang from Uvol village, recorded in Kokopo, East New Britain, November 2022 (v1.0). https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14505730.
Grace, George W. 1955. Columbia University notebook, pt. 3. In The George Grace linguistic research and slides of Melanesia collection, 1955–1956: Online documents. Unpublished MS. https://digital.library.manoa.hawaii.edu/grace/docs.
Pearson, Greg & van den Berg, René. 2008. Lote grammar sketch (Data Papers on Papua New Guinea Languages 54). Ukarumpa: SIL-PNG Academic Publications. https://www.sil.org/resources/archives/23806.
Ross, Malcolm. 1977–1982. Konomala Mamusi Uvol Tomoip. XWAV/MPEG/PDF/TIFF/JPEG. MR1-012 at catalog.paradisec.org.au. https://doi.org/10.4225/72/56FFE00776765.
Wycliffe Bible Translators. 2009. Tomunga hel heueu ngana: The New Testament in the Lote language of Papua New Guinea: Nupela Testamen long tokples Lote long Niugini. Wycliffe Bible Translators, Inc.
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Western Oceanic, North New Guinea, Ngero-Vitiaz, Vitiaz, Mengen

record.annotation: 'to turn'; possibly contains the causative prefix /hɛ-/
'to desire, to think' (Pearson & van den Berg 2008)
'to burn (person as subject), to cook (with fire)'
'to bake, to cook in an earth oven (TP: mumuim)'
'to suck, to suckle (a breast), to nurse'
'to lie, to lie down; to sleep'
'to lie, to lie down, to recline, to rest' (literally ''straighten bone')
'to lie, to lie down; to sleep'
made from the bones of flying foxes
'to shoot, to stab, to pierce, to stick'
'to shoot, to stab, to pierce, to stick'
'to throw (a stone); to hit, to pelt (as transitive)'
'stick, pole (for carrying pigs)' (Pearson & van den Berg 2008)
'to point out; to choose, to select'; possibly contains the causative prefix /hɛ-/
'to choose, to pick'; possibly contains the causative prefix /hɛ-/
'to blow (of the wind); to climb, to ascend, to go up; to grow'; also [aka]
'to mash, to smash, to pound (banana), to squeeze (grated coconut)'
'to take, to get, to carry (in the hand), to hold'; possibly /mɛn-ɛ/
'to mash, to smash, to pound (banana), to squeeze (grated coconut)'
'to throw (a stone); to hit, to pelt (as transitive)'
'down, low; to go down, to descend, to fall'
'to blow; to call (for someone), to shout'
'to blow (of the wind); to climb, to ascend, to go up; to grow'
'tree; fire' (Grace 1955; Ross 1977-1982; Pearson & van den Berg 2008)
'to light (of fire), to burn, to ignite'
'to burn (person as subject), to cook (with fire)'
'pain; painful; to hurt, to be in pain'
'to shame; to be ashamed, to feel shame (reflexive)'
'to blow (of the wind); to climb, to ascend, to go up; to grow'; also [aka]
'top'; postnominal and with possessive marking can function with the meaning 'above'
'bottom'; postnominal and with possessive marking can function with the meaning 'below'
'down, low; to go down, to descend, to fall'
far from both speaker and hearer
used in counting by fours (absolute numeral)
'TOP group.of.four'; used in counting by fours (adnominal numeral)
'group.of.four and one'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four and two'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four and three'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four [times] two'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four [times] 3PL two'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four [times] two and one'; used in counting by fours
'group.of.four [times] two and two'; used in counting by fours

record.item: ana non kina nai pe analox

record.annotation: 'TOP man bone-3SG [times] five'; difficult to elicit: probably rarely if ever used

record.item: ana non kina lime iri analox
record.annotation: 'TOP man bone-3SG [times] five [times] 3PL ten'; Barlow unable to elicit, but this phrase is used in the Lote Bible (Wycliffe Bible Translators 2009)
